Trial_Design.evidence: prospective, single-centre, randomised, placebo-controlled clinical study

Participants.evidence: patients scheduled for elective surgery under general or combined general and regional anaesthesia

Intervention.evidence: ICT group (intervention) or a control group that watched a video without anaesthetic risk content

Objective.evidence: The iPREDICT study aims to investigate the feasibility of using an interactive consultation tool (ICT) to improve patient awareness of anaesthesia-related risks.

Method_Outcome.evidence: assessed about anaesthetic risk knowledge after PAA and two days later

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 373 participants were randomised

Number_Analysed.evidence: 315 completed the assigned online module prior to their PAA

Result_Outcome.evidence: ICT group identifying significantly more correct risks than the control group (median 13.0 vs. 11.0, p < 0.05)
